data.text:
A lot of companies I have spoken to in India assume Event Marketing is a cost centre.

I, along with the 6 other companies we helped get started with event marketing, argue otherwise.

A common notion among us founders is to stick to the things we know and based on what I have seen, Indian companies have traditionally been strong in inbound and content marketing which continues till date. Event marketing is a much recent addition, often explored beyond Series A.

In contrast, companies in the US that adopt event marketing at earlier stages often see 20-30% of their leads generated from events. Even better, for those who start early, event marketing begins as a net-zero revenue effort and rapidly becomes profitable. While it may not play the volume game, it’s unrivaled in capturing high-quality enterprise and mid-market prospects. Enterprises rarely sign up on their own - while outbound can help reach them, event marketing gets them to notice you.

When executed correctly it can deliver a low-cost, high-intent pipeline that aligns perfectly with enterprise goals.

This year, we are committed to helping 10 companies kickstart their event marketing strategies and create a profitable lead gen engine. With a dedicated team and the expertise to support diverse industries, we’re ready to transform how companies approach event marketing.

If you are interested, reach out to me directly to know more.

#eventmarketing #marketing #enterprise #sales Harish Hari

🚨 Announcement alert! 🚨 

SaaS Insider’s conference dates for 2025 are here :fire:

SAASCON25 India - 24 July
DEVCON25 India - 25 July
SAASCON25 USA - 2 October

This year, we’re adopting a different approach: there will be no open registration forms. You would have to be invited by the SaaS Insider team to be a part of the conference.

The SaaS Insider team will curate and invite attendees. This allows us to be as thoughtful as possible, just as we are when selecting our speakers and partners.

SaaS Insider will be launching its US edition in 2025. Since there are so many great events targeting early stage companies we wanted to take a different approach here as well: by hosting a small curated event with only CXO's of unicorn product companies.

Our India events will be limited to 500 attendees and we will work towards creating the best possible attendees form established companies.

The key is that every attendee should have great takeaways, every conversation should be resourceful.

#saas #events Paul Hari

As someone who's been in the event tech space for years, the Cvent acquisition of Splash is no surprise—but it does raise concerns. Whenever these mergers happen, price hikes are inevitable.

Many companies already pay huge amounts just to print badges, and with this acquisition, costs are only going up.

At EventHQ, we’ve always believed that great event management tools shouldn’t break the bank. That’s why we offer unlimited registrations, badge printing, lead scanning, and more, all for much less.

For those moving away from Splash, we’re offering a 6-month free subscription to help ease the transition. Let’s chat if you’re looking for affordable solutions that don’t sacrifice functionality. 

https://lnkd.in/gH5ksntF

#EventTech #EventManagement #CventAcquisition

It's time for another book feature from the EventHQ team!

This week, we're featuring Steve Jobs by Walter Isaacson, the authorised biography of the legendary co-founder and former CEO of Apple. The book follows Jobs' incredible life and career, from his early days as a technology pioneer in Silicon Valley to his victorious return to Apple and the production of famous devices such as the iPhone, iPad, and iMac.Some quotes from the book that are noteworthy to Adarsh are,

- Relentless Pursuit of Passions - Jobs tirelessly chased his interests in technology and spirituality from a young age, driven by an unwavering focus.

- Prioritising the Essentials - When returning to Apple, Jobs famously culled 70% of products, recognising that deciding what not to do is as crucial as deciding what to do.

- Embracing Failure's Lessons - Jobs viewed failure not as a setback, but as an inevitable step on the path to success, offering opportunities for growth and improvement.

- Obsession with User Experience - Delivering exceptional customer experiences was paramount for Jobs, who was relentless in creating delightful products and services.

- Leaving a Meaningful Legacy - Jobs aspired to make a lasting, positive impact on the world, driven by a desire to "dent the universe" and improve people's lives.

Stay tuned for more of Team EventHQ's book features

#WeeklyBookEdition #SteveJobs

Last week, I got to be a part of the organising committee at India's largest Engineering and Tech Leadership Conference DEVCON24, hosted by SaaS Insider.

This was more than just a learning for me. It was truly a knowledgeable experience working so closely with people who have years of experience in the events industry. There were a lot of late-nighters, trials, and errors, but we did it, and I am thankful to the entire SaaS Insider and EventHQ team for making this conference possible. 

Here are some photos from when and how it happened ;)

Chameli Hari Harish Akshay Noorul Dharsan Shobha Arun Angelin Yash Venkatesh Abhishek Paul Kalyan Sabarinathan Sowmiya Likhitha

EventHQ is hiring for Backend Engineers ( Min 1.5 years to Max 3 years experience excluding internship ) in Bengaluru!

We are looking for the best of candidates to join us. We understand that switching companies could be one of the life changing decisions that anyone can make. So, we took the effort to chart out our salary/hike structure, as well as growth trajectory well in advance [read more in the hiring policy].

Location: Bengaluru, India

We are building a category creating tool. If you are interested in being a part of our journey, apply form the link in comments.

*You can read about our interview process in the hiring policy*

Some FAQs on our hiring process:

Do we negotiate on Salary? 
No, if the salary bracket falls within your expected salary range, you are always welcome to explore career opportunities with EventHQ.

Is remote work available? 
Remote working is not available. All employees are required to work on-site at the company’s office location.

Location office?
We are located at Koramangala, Bengaluru.

Do we entertain hiring agencies? 
No, we prefer to have our hiring and sourcing in house.

Chameli Hari Akshay Noorul Faheem Anvarali

#saas #hiring #engineering #backendengineering #nodejs #nestjs #javascript #javascriptdeveloper #typescript

We are thrilled to announce the launch of EventHQ for Startups and Communities!

Understanding the importance of support, resources, and networks in scaling ventures, this initiative is our commitment to fostering growth and collaboration within the entrepreneurial ecosystem.

What can a community take out of this program?
- Networking, introductions to partners , potential sponsors, mentorship, vendor connections, etc.
- We have walked the journey of building SaaS Insider into a successful community, and we will help you with whatever we can to make your community successful.

Why an event-specific program for startups?
- Plan and strategize a global event marketing plan with a startup budget and the right partnerships in place.
- Scaling your community game to increase your brand awareness and reduce CAC.
- Help you set up an event marketing team when you need a dedicated internal team.
- Discounted tickets and sponsorship opportunities with global brands.

At EventHQ, this program is a reflection of our dedication to supporting the ecosystems where startups and communities thrive.

If you are interested in applying, check the comments section for more information.

#eventmarketing #events #founder #network #community

UPI is a loss-making business. Then why are companies like Jio Financial Services, Flipkart, and others launching UPI services?!

For all the good UPI has done for India’s digital payments ecosystem, it has not been a good business proposition for the players involved.

Look at the financials of some major UPI players. 

PhonePe recorded a loss of Rs 2,795 crore in FY23. Paytm’s losses stood at Rs 1,776 crore. Amazon Pay’s losses were at Rs 1,499 crore.

Other players like BharatPe, Google Pay, etc are also deep in losses.

And it is not exactly the fault of the fintech companies in the ecosystem. UPI as a business is itself a loss-making proposition because you cannot make money out of it. 

The government does not allow it!

You see, the National Payments Council of India has clarified that UPI services need to be free for users to promote digital payments in India!

But if players are not allowed to charge users when they make payments, why are so many companies still working in the segment and why are newer players like Flipkart and Jio Financial Services trying to enter the market?

Seems rather odd, right?

But there is a reason why companies are going the UPI way.

The thing is, UPI has become a stepping stone of sorts for financial services. 

Major players with UPI at the core of their service want to build a distribution of users and then divert them to other financial services like bill payments, lending, stock broking, etc.

For example, you could get a loan via PhonePe, or recharge your phone through Google Pay, or buy stocks via Paytm.

This is where the fintechs make real money. And to get here, UPI seems like a good entry point.

Now about Jio and Flipkart entering the UPI game, do you think they can take on PhonePe, Google Pay, etc?

Let us know in the comments and follow Finshots for more!

****

#india #finance #UPI

We are launching EventHQ's interactive demo site now and we would love to have your feedback!

Check out the demo : https://demo.eventhq.com/ 

The biggest challenge for me till date with EventHQ is educating people on EventOps. EventHQ is an EventOps and intelligence platform. What we want to build is a platform that will give you access to all historical data of your company's event marketing and use that to analyse and predict the outcomes.

In future, with our AI you can predict how many registration you need to achieve your attendee and revenue goals. You can also just enter your pipeline and revenue targets for the quarter and the year and EventHQ can give you scenarios and a marketing plan to achieve it.

EventOps is an upcoming market, and the market is currently dominated with Excel. So we wanted to do an experiment of educating our visitors even before we book a call with them.

Our first experiment is to create a interactive demo site like Mercury that can showcase our product.

Please do tag any field marketer or event marketers in your network and we will reach out to them and hear their feedback

Ps : Its connected to a static data via Retool so it will be much slower than the actual instance.

#eventops #eventmarketing #eventmanager #fieldmarketing Akshay Hari Harish

Finding it hard to believe when someone proposes a solution to your biggest problems? We've all been there. But turn that skepticism into curiosity and watch #EventHQ transform the way you look at event data.
